value.name: Fear of Tulsa police remains in African American community 100 years after massacre
value.description: There's been undeniable progress in the relationship between the Tulsa police and the city's Black community in the past 100 years. Then again, it's hard to imagine it could have gotten worse. Complaints about police bias and a lack of enough minority officers remain.

value.name: SUNDAY CONVERSATION: One year after George Floyd's death, civil rights leader U.S, Rep. Green fighting for change
value.description: May 25 marked the one-year anniversary of the death of George Floyd. His death rocked the nation — so much so that protests, rallies and marches sprang up across the country despite the omnipresent threat of COVID-19.
